meanings.sent1: The bird's chirping was quasiperiodic, sometimes loud and sometimes quiet.
meanings.sent2: The quasiperiodic rainfall made it difficult to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The quasiperiodic honking of the car horn sounded like a confused goose.
meanings.sent4: Her quasiperiodic visits always brought a sense of unpredictability to our routine.
meanings.sent5: The flickering streetlight cast a quasiperiodic glow on the deserted road.

meanings.definition: Having a pattern that repeats but not exactly.
meanings.sent1: The quasiperiodic design on the rug featured similar shapes but in varying sizes.
meanings.sent2: The quasiperiodic melody of the song kept the listeners intrigued.
meanings.sent3: The quasiperiodic dance moves of the robot made it look like it was glitching.
meanings.sent4: His quasiperiodic mood swings made it hard to predict his reactions.
meanings.sent5: The quasiperiodic flickering of the candle flame created a mesmerizing effect in the room.
